00047 #define _FC_STORAGE_H_

00053 // Simple data objects: int arrays, linked lists & masks
00054 
00055 /** \name Typedefs */
00056 //-------------------------------
00057 //@{
00058 
00059 /**
00060  * \ingroup   SimpleDataObjects
00061  * \brief Coordinates data structure
00062  *
00063  * \description
00064  * 
00065  *    Structure to hold coordinates. Maximum dimensionality is 3. 
00066  *    (This is essentially a double[3] declaration).
00067  */
00068 typedef double FC_Coords[3];
00069 
00070 /**
00071  * \ingroup   SimpleDataObjects
00072  * \brief Vector data structure
00073  *
00074  * \description
00075  * 
00076  *    Structure to hold a vector, assuming that it originates
00077  *    at the origin. Maximum dimensionality is 3. (This is
00078  *    essentially a double[3] declaration).
00079  *
00080  */
00081 typedef double FC_Vector[3];
00082 
00083 /**
00084  * \ingroup  SimpleDataObjects
00085  * \brief Sorted, exclusive, self-exanding int array
00086  *
00087  * \description
00088  *
00089  *   Use this object and it's functions to maintain a sorted int array.
00090  *   The array is self expanding and maintains a sorted, unique, set
00091  *   of integers. The array does not automatically shrink, but \ref 
00092  *   fc_squeezeSortedIntArray() can be used to minimize memory usage.
00093  *
00094  * \modifications 
00095  *    - 2006/06/06 ACG created
00096  *    - 2008/05/02 CDU Updated to support getting unsorted vals back
00097  */
00098 typedef struct {
00099   int  numVal;     /**< number of values */
00100   int  maxNumVal;  /**< total allocated space (max possible number of values) */
00101   int* vals;      /**< int array holding the values */
00102   int  nextTicket; /**< the next unique ticket to assign to an inserted val */
00103   int* tickets;   /**< each val has an insert ticket so we can extract vals in order they were inserted */
00104 } FC_SortedIntArray;
00105 
00106 /**
00107  * \ingroup  SimpleDataObjects
00108  * \brief Sorted, exclusive, self-exanding array of data blobs
00109  *
00110  * \description
00111  *
00112  *   Use this object and it's functions to maintain a sorted array of data
00113  *   "blobs". It's implemented as an array of void pointers and the user must
00114  *   provide the size of the blobs and a comparison function. The array is self
00115  *   expanding and maintains a sorted, unique, set of the blobs integers. The
00116  *   array does not automatically shrink, but \ref fc_squeezeSortedBlobArray()
00117  *   can be used to minimize memory usage.
00118  *
00119  * \todo ?Store the compare function and have it provided during init? What
00120  *     Happens on free?
00121  *
00122  * \modifications 
00123  *    - 06/07/06 WSD created
00124  */
00125 typedef struct {
00126   int numBlob;     /**< number of blobs */
00127   int maxNumBlob;  /**< total allocated space (max possible number of blobs) */
00128   void** blobs;    /**< array of blobs */
00129 } FC_SortedBlobArray;
00130 
00131 //@}

00134 FC_ReturnCode fc_initSortedIntArray(FC_SortedIntArray *sia);
00135 int fc_isSortedIntArrayValid(FC_SortedIntArray* sia);

00137                        FC_SortedIntArray *sia_dest);

00139                   int* numVal);

00141                int* numVal, int** values);

00143                   int* numValue, int** values);

00148                        int* array, int isSorted);
00149 int fc_deleteIntFromSortedIntArray(FC_SortedIntArray *sia, int i);
00150 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSortedIntArrayFront(FC_SortedIntArray *sia, int* value);
00151 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSortedIntArrayBack(FC_SortedIntArray *sia, int* value); 
00152 int fc_popSortedIntArrayFront(FC_SortedIntArray *sia);
00153 int fc_popSortedIntArrayBack(FC_SortedIntArray *sia);
00154 FC_ReturnCode fc_squeezeSortedIntArray(FC_SortedIntArray *sia);
00155 void fc_freeSortedIntArray(FC_SortedIntArray *sia);
00156 FC_ReturnCode fc_printSortedIntArray(FC_SortedIntArray *sia);

00160 int fc_isSortedBlobArrayValid(FC_SortedBlobArray* sba);

00162                   int* numBlob);

00164                int* numBlob, void*** blobs);

00166              int blobCmp(const void* blob1, const void* blob2),
00167              void** found_blob);

00169              int blobCmp(const void* blob1, const void* blob2));
00170 int fc_deleteBlobFromSortedBlobArray(FC_SortedBlobArray *sba, void* blob,
00171                    int blobCmp(const void* blob1, const void* blob2),
00172              void** deleted_blob);
00173 FC_ReturnCode fc_squeezeSortedBlobArray(FC_SortedBlobArray *sba);
00174 void fc_freeSortedBlobArray(FC_SortedBlobArray *sba);
